newsitem.title: DUBAI: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Dec 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - United Arab Emirates - Dec 5.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the United Arab Emirates press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Gulf Cooperation Council states urge Bahrain to reverse its desision to boycott Saturday's summit.
Bahrain has said it would boycott the summit to protest a territorial dispute with Qatar.
- Dubai retail gold trade cooling off.
- UAE oil income to rise by 20 percent to $14.64 billion in 1996, economist says.
- Gulf Arab foreign ministers prepare agenda for Saturday's summit.
Summit agenda items include a rise in Moslem extremism, regional "terrorism", ways of dealing with regional powers Iran and Iraq and the Middle East peace process.
- Oman says it has frozen ties with Israel.
